result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Airnester Weemstewart

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Airnester Weemstewart appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christopher Ertl appeared by video as a Friend of The Court.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case scheduled for motion on postconviction relief hearing.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  
Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  
The Court appointed Attorney Christopher Ertl to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. 
The Court ordered that the Defendant is NOT required to reimburse Milwaukee County.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Airnester Weemstewart appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the due to no court reporter availability. 
Case scheduled for status of counsel. Defendant ordered to contact SPD Office to provide additional information. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court is down and unable to hear this case.  Defendant appeared in Court and was given next court date and zoom information.  Case scheduled for 9/13/2022 at 1:30 pm for Status of Counsel by zoom.

Defendant Airnester Weemstewart in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Status of Counse
 ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.  Defendant is indigent and qualifies for a State Public Defender. 
Court  ordered case adjourned due to aState Public Defender Office need additional time to appoint counsel.
Status Conference scheduled August 12, 2022 at 1:30pm,.
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bond previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ELM.

Defendant Airnester Weemstewart in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-29-2022 @1p

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
5/26/22.  sb
